title: RIP Garens critical strike itemization.
body:
atmas impaler deleted
{{item:3142}} reworked into an assassin item
{{item:3078}} crit removed aswell
{{item:3031}} wont have crit anymore

no more items without taking too much sacrifices in defense and wasting a ton of gold on useless attack speed.

ill miss this build.

replies.body: at least we have storm razor qq

guaranteed crit and a burst of MS are more important than some meager attack speed imo

>
> guaranteed crit and a burst of MS are more important than some meager attack speed imo

eh. the main issue id have with it is probably the lack of control over the passive. youll always have to open a fight with a spin, or you blow it prematurely with your q.

the old {{item:3142}} + {{item:3031}} fit his kit so well, that you could run them as your only two offensive items and go into defense from there. i fear, there will never be such good crit items for him anymore.

spin doesnt reset the timer.

otoh for some reason Q won't apply the crit (apparently any modified auto attack won't right now -- hopefully a bug) but you can get 2 free crits before and after spin and it's a fairly big chunk of extra damage

The Q thing is a bug, should be fixed on PBE tomorrow (had quite a few things go wrong in pushing it to PBE). Q-E-Auto should proc it twice if you spin for 2.5 seconds.

For a while in testing it just gave you 100% crit chance til you critted something, which was super fun on Garen. Turns out we can't actually let Jhin have 4000 gold of free stats while he ults, though - who'd've thought?

you know, something that unlocks a decent amount of crit chance at 10 minutes, or at lvl 10 like the transcendence rune to avoid early lane rng.

another possibility would be a fourth bounty hunter rune, that grants like 5% crit chance per unique takedown.

because at this point, if adc will be able to get 100% crit chance off 3 items anyway, we might aswell add a couple rune options. its not like they can stack a 120% crit.

the crit on his spin was always there.

it was one of the reasons why atmas was even the item that was most effectively used by garen. other fighters didnt care about the 18% crit at all.

they decided to keep it with the juggernaut update, since people asked for it on the pbe boards, and riot repertoir said that the crit scaling can stay because it doesnt factor into his power budget.

trust me. ive been running crit garen since long before season 5. before season 3 even and the introduction of the ad caster version of cleaver. hence the name, when i was still running {{item:3142}} + {{item:3031}} as my two crit items into a defensive build.

you might be thinking about his q. because decisive strike used to be treated as an ability, and not an empowered auto attack.

hence, why it went through abilities like teemos blind, and jax dodge.

since it was changed to be treated as an auto attack, it lost its immunity to these effects, but was also able to crit from there on out.

just to be sure that im not full of shit, i double checked his patch history. there was no mention about the addition to the crit scaling on any one of the changes they did to his spin, back to some 1.0.x patch. so it was definitely always there. otherwise the addition would have been documented.

Strangely enough, I swear this was added to his E at some point-I thought when he got his bruiser update. But I can't find it documented anywhere...Maybe I'm remembering wrong, but I swore it stated "can now" instead of "added for clarity" or some such effect.

Wait a second my dude. Does stormrazor grant +100% crit chance until your next attack or does it only proc on basic attack?

Cuz if they mess this up we could potentially have a bugged permanent 100% crit chance spin so long as you don't hit with Q before you spin.

It should be clear by now RIOT games do not give a shit about Garen. If it's not a super flashy e sports centric champ or a freewin high skin sales champ (Riven, Yasuo I am looking at you) they don't give a fuck.

In fact I think they're deliberately killing Garen so they can rework him and pretend that the juggernaut rework wasn't the root cause of Garens utter uselessness right now so they can be praised for getting a shit champ out the gutter down the line. 

Getting a level 4 stage 2 Q buff by which point you've lost lane control and been ganked or a tiny W buff after 120 minions which on average is going to be about 15 / 20 minutes into the game...... absolutely  useless. And halfway through a season as it's winding down and changes are coming in for next season.  Absolute joke.

> [{quoted}](name=FridgesArePpl2,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=UlrOOMva,comment-id=00110000,timestamp=2018-05-02T15:37:05.207+0000)
>
> yeah because the infinity edge rework is really going to hurt Garen

its not going to directly hurt him, but its basically killing his last real effecient crit item that he can pick up.

the current {{item:3031}} isnt just a troll item on him. its a legit item that you can build into a serious bruiser build. its 100% efficient on him. you get the full effect of the item on your main damage abilities and auto attacks. his spin mechanic normalizes crit chance, so even with only 20% crit chance, youre basically guaranteed to get a damage amp on your spin from the item. its actually one of the strongest offensive items you can buy on garen.

even if the new stormrazor makes it to live, and you can make it work on him, the flat attack speed on the item and the fact that the first attack speed proc off the passive overlaps with his spin means, youre at least losing some efficiency.

the changes dont make him less vaible than he is now, but they hurt his build diversity. its just kind of sad that this build path just kindof died out with the changes over the years just because hes such a niche character who wants just raw crit and ad and doesnt want attack speed at the same time.
